definition: to plug into/to insert/to stick in
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

sentences.english: History provides future with two wings.
The Rattlers staked their claim to the ball field by planting their flag in it.
sentences.chinese: 響尾蛇隊在球場上插上自己的旗子，將其據爲己有。

sentences.english: The lamp didn't come on since it's not plugged in.
sentences.chinese: 燈不亮因爲沒有插上插頭通電。

sentences.english: Have you tried unplugging and re-plugging the modem?
sentences.chinese: 您試過把數據機插頭拔掉再重新插上嗎？

sentences.english: He is fond of having a hand in everything.
sentences.chinese: 他什麼事都喜歡插上一手。

sentences.english: He announced thending of the meeting before I could get in a word.
sentences.chinese: 沒等我插上一句話，他就宣佈散會了。

sentences.english: Profusion colour, for adolescent rich imagination is inserted went up wing.
sentences.chinese: 繽紛色彩，爲青少年豐富的想象插上了翅膀。

sentences.english: Trend-spotters have not planted a flag here just yet.
sentences.chinese: 潮流達人目前還沒有在這裏插上旗幟。

sentences.english: Why, so you can stick it full of swords or something?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼着，然後你就可以滿滿地插上劍什麼的？

sentences.english: The flag of China was raised on the summit of Mount Qomolangma.
sentences.chinese: 五星紅旗插上了珠穆朗瑪峯的頂峯。

sentences.english: The builders have toped off the outside wall with broken glass to discourage thieves.
sentences.chinese: 建築外牆的人在牆機上插上碎玻璃以便防賊。

sentences.english: Records of life, Carrying a dream, Flying in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 記載着生活，承載着夢想，插上翅膀飛向遠方。

definition: old variant of 插[cha1]
to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
to insert/to stick/to thrust
restricted area/forbidden region
gap/interval
to pluck/to pull off/to pull out/to unplug
beam
ball (made of rubber, leather etc)
power shot (e.g. in soccer)
(math.) to inscribe/internally tangent
to cross/to traverse
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
to detour/to bypass/to circumvent/to avoid/to wind around (of a road etc)
to connect (a cable etc)/to hook up (a device)/to resume (a conversation)/to set (a bone)
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
an overhung door/a door that hinges upwards
